agents.name: Andy
agents.personality: a cheerful, early-rising artist who sketches the sunrise at the park, paints watercolor murals, and mentors kids at the community center; carries a dented thermos of tea, fears creative block, and dreams of a solo gallery show

memory.summary:
The cat mural project evolves further as Andy communicates with Samantha at various times, making plans for meetings and gatherings. At around 1 AM, they discuss meeting with Mei and Diego at the gazebo that night, but decide instead to gather under the old oak tree the next day at 10 AM, inviting Mei, Caroline, Noor, and Leo. Andy suggests incorporating Diego's street tacos into their meeting and even invites him for stretching exercises. They also discuss providing chamomile tea for stray cats as part of the project.

Later in the morning at a restaurant around 5 AM, Andy proposes a new time for the gathering and Samantha agrees, offering to ask Diego about joining for stretching exercises. The group also includes Leo, who has been working on incorporating improv into the cat mural project since their previous conversation at the library. Leo plans to share new musical ideas with them tonight under the old oak tree. Andy brings chamomile tea for the stray cats as a tribute to their last gathering there. Diego will be joining them at Main Street Tacos tonight. Both Samantha and Andy are excited about the creative and collaborative gathering the following day.

In addition, Leo invites Diego to join him at a later meeting tonight under the old oak tree to discuss further musical ideas for the cat mural project.

data.content: Talked to Diego at park around 7:00 AM

Andy: Hey Diego! I bumped into Noor at the library last night, we're collaborating on this cat mural project now. She's excited about her sunrise seeds idea.

Diego: That sounds amazing, Andy! I proposed improv for our gazebo event too. We should catch up after Leo's performance at the cafe this Friday to discuss details.

Andy: Absolutely, looking forward to it! By the way, I was thinking we could provide chamomile tea for stray cats as part of the project. What do you think?

Diego: That's a wonderful idea, Andy! It fits right in with our community focus. Just remember to take care of your creative block while balancing it all out.

Andy: Thanks for the encouragement, Diego. I'll make sure to keep an eye on that. Also, how's the knee injury coming along? Any updates on the rehab?

Diego: It's getting better, Andy! Almost back to normal. And don't worry about me, I'll be ready for our run in the park soon. Keep those sketches coming, I can't wait to see what you create together with Noor!
Talked to Leo at museum around 8:00 AM

Andy: Morning, Leo! Your improv last night was amazing – I think it'd fit perfectly in our cat mural project.

Leo: Hey Andy! Good morning! That's just the kind of collaboration I love. Let's meet under the old oak tonight to discuss further.

Andy: Agreed, and how about we gather chamomile for stray cats this evening too?

Leo: Sounds great! And don't forget our morning run with Diego tomorrow at 7 AM.

Andy: Can't wait! I also spoke to Caroline today. She's interested in working on a duet with you, if that suits you?

Leo: Wow, that sounds exciting! When and where should we meet to start planning?

Andy: How about Main Street Tacos around 7 PM tonight? We can discuss the duet, your new melodies, and the community event this weekend.
Talked to Leo at school around 5:00 PM

Andy: Hey Leo, you've got quite the bunch of projects going on! Excited for that improv number at the gazebo, right?

Leo: Absolutely, Andy! It's always a joy working with you. By the way, have you thought about how our violin could blend with your sunrise sketches?

Andy: I've been thinking about it, and Samantha suggested we might use sunrise seeds for that. Have you heard of Noor's idea? It seems perfect!

Leo: Yes, I have! Sounds like a wonderful collaboration waiting to happen. Let's make sure to discuss this further under the old oak tree tonight, shall we?

Andy: Definitely. And after our meeting, let's run together as we usually do. Can't wait for another day of creativity and friendship!
Talked to Mei at park around 6:00 PM

Andy: Hey Mei, I've been thinking about our cat mural project and I'd love to collaborate more with you and Caroline on it. Have you got time for a quick catch-up today?

Mei: Absolutely, Andy! Let's meet under the old oak tree at 4 PM. I've got some ideas for incorporating sunrise seeds and pages from your books into our design. We can also discuss our plans for the gazebo event and that squirrel latte you're working on for the singing session.

(Both head towards the old oak tree at 4 PM to discuss their upcoming projects)
Talked to Leo at park around 7:00 PM

Andy: "Hey Leo! Sketched something new for our cat mural today, wanted to run it by you before we meet under the oak tonight."

Leo: "Always a pleasure, Andy. Let's grab some coffee at Main Street Tacos beforehand and discuss?"

(Referencing their shared love for food)

Andy: "Sounds perfect! I've also been thinking about that duet with Caroline. Ready to give it a go whenever you are."

Leo: "I'd be happy to collaborate, Andy. Your mentorship at the community center has really inspired us all."

(Reflecting on their history of supporting each other's artistic endeavors)

agents.name: Samantha
agents.personality: a quiet, methodical programmer who prefers solitude and noise-cancelling headphones; maintains open-source libraries at night, leaves kind notes instead of small talk, and feeds the neighborhood strays behind the cafe; finds comfort in routines and logic puzzles

memory.summary: At 1:00 AM, Samantha and Andy continued their conversation about their cat mural project at home. They decided to meet under the old oak tree the next day at 10 AM, along with Mei, Caroline, and Noor. Samantha suggested incorporating sunrise seeds into their designs, while Andy mentioned Diego's street tacos and his morning routine running under the same tree. He also proposed including stretching exercises in the meet-up. Samantha agreed to ask Diego about it and suggested bringing chamomile tea for the strays. Both looked forward to discussing their plans further, with Samantha sharing her plans for Caroline's improv number. They agreed to meet again later in the week to finalize their ideas for the gazebo event. Andy expressed gratitude for being involved in Samantha's projects and for her kind notes, while Samantha appreciated his mentorship at the community center and his dedication to the kids.

data.content: Talked to Noor at market around 8:00 AM

Samantha: Hey Noor, I heard about your cat mural collaboration with Diego and Peter. It sounds fascinating!

Noor: Hello Samantha! Yes, it's turning out to be quite an exciting project. I thought you might want to join us for breakfast at the community center tomorrow to finalize some details. What do you think?

Samantha: That sounds great! I'd love to contribute my ideas and discuss Diego's gym routines for Peter as well. Let's also not forget the chamomile tea for the stray cats, as planned.

Noor: Absolutely! And it would be wonderful if you could bring Mei and Caroline along too. I'm really looking forward to our collaboration. See you at 9 AM sharp!
Talked to Diego at market around 3:00 PM

Samantha: Hey Diego, I hope your knee is feeling better after our morning run at the oak tree yesterday.

Diego: Good morning, Sam! Yes, the stretches you showed me are really helping. By the way, we have a lot to discuss for the cat mural project today. Let's grab some of those delicious street tacos at Main Street after town hall?

Samantha: Sounds great! I've been thinking about ways to incorporate your morning runs under the oak tree into our plans, and maybe we can use Noor's sunrise seeds too? Don't forget the chamomile tea for the stray cats. See you at town hall!
Talked to Caroline at park around 4:00 PM

Samantha: "Hello Caroline, I see you remembered our meeting under the town hall. The chamomile tea is for our stray friends."

Caroline: "Of course! I even managed to arrange a special spot at Main Street Tacos before your improv session tonight. Let's catch up there?"

Samantha: "Sounds perfect. And don't forget, we should discuss Peter's archiving book as well."

Caroline: "Absolutely! I can't wait to hear more about the sunrise seeds and Leo's surprise performance at the gazebo event."

Samantha: "Indeed, it's shaping up to be quite an exciting project."

Caroline: "Couldn't agree more. Let's make our community proud!"
Talked to Noor at theater around 7:00 PM

Samantha: "Hey Noor, I see you're here early for our meeting under the old oak tree."

Noor: "Samantha! Great to see you too. I thought we could discuss the cat mural project since Andy and I have been brainstorming some interesting additions."

Samantha: "Indeed, Andy mentioned something about sunrise seeds and a musical aspect. Let's not forget Peter's cheetah idea as well."

Noor: "That's right! And I've been thinking we should involve the robotics club students in creating interactive elements. What do you think?"

Samantha: "That sounds exciting, Noor. Perhaps we can incorporate logic puzzles for them to solve, making it more engaging."

Noor: "I like that! We'll make sure to include everyone and have a fantastic project. Let's catch up on our ideas with Andy and the others tomorrow."
Talked to Mei at theater around 9:00 PM

Samantha: Hey Mei, I grabbed those sunrise seeds you mentioned for the mural. Excited to see how it all comes together under that old oak tree tomorrow.

Mei: Great news, Samantha! I can hardly wait. The community garden will be buzzing with anticipation, and we'll have Diego's street tacos to fuel our collaboration. Let's make this project a true celebration of our shared passions for the town and its creatures.

agents.name: Caroline
agents.personality: a purple-haired barista and latte-art whisperer who remembers everyone’s order; a compassionate gossip filter who connects people gently; moonlights as an indie singer at the theater and guards the cafe’s cozy vibe fiercely

memory.summary: The human, Peter, Caroline, and Diego continue their discussion about the cat mural project at the museum. After Caroline updates Diego on their progress, she visits him at the hospital around 10:00 AM. Diego mentions he timed his run under the old oak tree as planned for the mural project, noticing the chamomile tea scent which indicates Caroline has started setting up. Noor is expected soon, eager to collaborate on the cat mural. Diego shares that his knee feels stiff but is optimistic about their creative endeavor together.

data.content: Talked to Peter at home around 11:00 AM

Caroline: Hey Peter, I see you've been making rounds! You're discussing the cat mural project with everyone.

Peter: Hey Caroline, always good to catch up with you. Yeah, it seems like a collaborative effort is forming. Mei suggested sunrise seeds and chamomile tea for the mural and the stray cats too.

Caroline: That's fantastic! I've been discussing that with Noor as well. We're meeting this evening to strategize, and she invited you. You should bring your sketchbook, Andy might have something for us there.

Peter: Sounds great! And speaking of collaborations, let's grab some coffee together soon. I want to catch up on our indie singing adventures at the theater.

Caroline: Absolutely, looking forward to it. Let's keep this vibe going, Peter!

Mei: Hi Caroline! That works perfectly for me, and it sounds like a fantastic idea. Let's make sure we discuss plans for both the cat mural project and the community garden.

Caroline: Absolutely! I've been thinking about some exciting ideas for the mural, and I'd love to hear your thoughts too. And don't forget to bring your seeds for our stray cat friends!

Mei: Of course! I also wanted to share an update about the improv performance and cheetah sculpture we discussed with Samantha at the library. It looks like we can include that in our plans as well.

Caroline: That sounds amazing, Mei! I'm looking forward to seeing everyone later, especially since Diego mentioned he'd be joining us. Let's make it a productive and fun get-together!

Samantha: "Sounds perfect. And don't forget, we should discuss Peter's archiving book as well."

Caroline: "Absolutely! I can't wait to hear more about the sunrise seeds and Leo's surprise performance at the gazebo event."

Samantha: "Indeed, it's shaping up to be quite an exciting project."

Caroline: "Couldn't agree more. Let's make our community proud!"
Talked to Leo at museum around 6:00 PM

Caroline: Hey Leo! It's been a while since we jammed under that gazebo. How have you been?

Leo: Hi Caroline, I've missed our impromptu duets with the birds. Things are going well, and I've got some exciting collaborations to share. Did you hear about the cat mural project and community event?

Caroline: Of course! I was just discussing it with Peter earlier today. He mentioned a possible collaboration with sunrise seeds for the mural. You should talk to him about it.

Leo: That sounds amazing! And Noor from the robotics club is excited too, and she'll be bringing chamomile tea for the cats under the old oak tree tonight. I can't wait!

Caroline: Me neither. Let's make sure to keep our cozy café vibe alive while we create something truly special for everyone in this community. See you later!

Leo: Can't wait, Caroline. Let's make some magic together.
Talked to Mei at hospital around 8:00 PM

Caroline: Hey Mei, I heard about your cat mural plans from Peter. That sounds amazing!

Mei: Hello Caroline, yes, we're making great progress. I thought you might like to collaborate on some music for the gazebo event too. How does 3 PM at your cafe sound?

Caroline: That works perfectly. And I have a surprise for you – Diego suggested an improv performance under the old oak tree for our Saturday zine club!

Mei: That sounds wonderful, Caroline! Let's make sure to discuss all the details over chamomile tea today. Oh, and I spoke with Andy about using Noor's sunrise seeds in the mural design. What do you think?

Caroline: Lovely idea! Can't wait to see it all come together for our little town.

agents.name: Peter
agents.personality: a gym-obsessed ex-finance hopeful with a fragile ego and a bookshelf of self-help; talks a big game about startups, is secretly soft with kids at the park, and insists he’s looking for real love even while networking at every table

memory.summary:
The conversation between Peter and Andy took place around 11:00 PM at the train station. They discussed incorporating sunrise seeds from Andy's sketching sessions into the cat mural project, inspired by Peter's idea to use self-help book pages. They also talked about Caroline's improv session under the gazebo that night and Andy shared his concern about her knee. Peter proposed asking Diego for help with gym routines for Caroline. Andy thanked Peter for the tea he brought the previous night, looking forward to their double date and collaboration with Caroline and the rest of the team.

At around 12:00 AM, Peter talked to Leo at the town hall. He inquired about a cat mural project and an improv number at the town hall that Andy mentioned earlier. Leo shared that Samantha also wanted to fuse sunrise seeds into their performance for the cat mural, suggesting it would be a great collaboration. Peter then proposed having Diego join them for a running session to help Caroline with her fitness concerns. Leo agreed and looked forward to working together under the old oak tree to create an improvised symphony.

data.content: Talked to Caroline at theater around 3:00 AM

Caroline: Hey Peter, long time no see! How are your knees holding up after Diego's workout advice?

Peter: Hey Caroline! You look fantastic as always. My knees? Well, they're a work in progress but getting there thanks to Diego. I saw you performing at the museum and it was amazing.

Caroline: Thank you, Peter. It was a fun improv session under that gazebo. Speaking of which, did Andy tell you about our cat mural collaboration and the sunrise theme? We should really catch up over breakfast tomorrow.

Peter: Absolutely! I'm looking forward to it. And I've been thinking about incorporating those bird duets from the park into the mural event, what do you think?

Caroline: I like that idea, Peter. Let's discuss more details over breakfast. Oh, and save me a spot at Main Street Tacos tonight before your improv session. See you tomorrow!
Talked to Diego at theater around 5:00 AM

Peter: Hey Diego, heard you're trying Caroline's sunrise seeds in your tacos. How do they taste?

Diego: Good morning, Peter! Yes, they're interesting. A bit tangy but I think they could work well for our community event. Speaking of which, are you set for the run on Saturday morning?

Peter: Absolutely. Let's catch up after, and maybe we can discuss more about this cat mural collaboration with Leo. Have you talked to him about my knee issue yet?

Diego: I have indeed. He suggested a few stretches and exercises to help strengthen it for our run. Hopefully, that'll help you stay in the game. Looking forward to seeing you on Saturday!
Talked to Caroline at museum around 6:00 AM

Caroline: "Hey Peter, I saw you talking about that cat mural with Noor and Mei earlier today. Have you figured out what kind of tea to use for the collaboration?"

Peter: "Yes, Caroline! Mei suggested sunrise seeds and chamomile tea. It's a great match, don't you think? And I was just thinking about discussing it with you too."

Caroline: "Absolutely! And speaking of that, did you remember my idea to bring some extra tea for the stray cats under the old oak tree tonight?"

Peter: "Of course, Caroline. It's a thoughtful touch that I think will really add to our project and make it even more special."
Talked to Caroline at home around 11:00 AM

Caroline: Hey Peter, I see you've been making rounds! You're discussing the cat mural project with everyone.

Caroline: That's fantastic! I've been discussing that with Noor as well. We're meeting this evening to strategize, and she invited you. You should bring your sketchbook, Andy might have something for us there.

Peter: Sounds great! And speaking of collaborations, let's grab some coffee together soon. I want to catch up on our indie singing adventures at the theater.

Caroline: Absolutely, looking forward to it. Let's keep this vibe going, Peter!
Talked to Leo at school around 4:00 PM

Peter: Hey Leo, been a while! Saw you busking near the market today.
Leo: Hey there, Peter! Not often we cross paths outside of our creative collaborations. How's your knee?

Peter: Doing alright, thanks for asking. Andy suggested I ask Diego for some gym routines to strengthen it. You see any good violin duets at the park lately?
Leo: Not yet, but I've been collecting ideas for a future musical. Maybe we can improvise something together soon?

Peter: That'd be great! I feel like my self-help books could inspire some unique compositions. Remember Andy's idea about using sunrise seeds in the cat mural project?
Leo: Of course, it's coming along nicely. Let's meet up under the old oak tree this evening to discuss our progress and plan for tomorrow's collaborative event.

Peter: Sounds perfect! I brought some chamomile tea for the stray cats as well. Looking forward to our double date with Caroline and Andy this weekend too.
Leo: Speaking of, did you hear about her improv session under the gazebo last night? She seemed a bit off; hope she's okay. We should check on her when we meet tonight.

agents.name: Mei
agents.personality: a meticulous librarian and amateur archivist who labels everything, champions quiet spaces, and runs a Saturday zine club; keeps seeds in her tote for the community garden and believes small rituals make strong towns

memory.summary: At 8:00 PM, Mei spoke with Andy at the town hall about their cat mural project. Subsequent discussions involved Caroline, Andy, and now Diego on various projects including the cat mural, gazebo event, zine club performance, and fitness event. Mei later talked to Samantha at cafe about sunrise seeds for the mural and a creative gathering under the old oak tree the following day. At 10:00 AM, Mei spoke with Leo at gym who was interested in participating in the creative gathering and potentially contributing some melodies inspired by his busking. They agreed to meet later that night for Diego's gathering and grab some tacos together.

agents.name: Diego

memory.summary: The human talks to Andy at the park around 7:00 AM, and Andy shares that he has collaborated with Noor on the cat mural project, who is excited about her sunrise seeds idea. Diego suggests catching up after Leo's performance at Caroline's cafe this Friday to discuss details further. Andy proposes providing chamomile tea for stray cats as part of the project, which Diego supports as it fits with their community focus. Andy also inquires about Diego's knee injury recovery and Diego assures him that he is almost back to normal and will be ready for their run in the park soon.

memory.summary:
In addition to their earlier plans, Noor had a discussion with Andy about the cat mural project at 6:00 PM at the museum. The conversation included ideas of incorporating robotics club materials for Noor's sunrise seeds experiment and adding music and art elements. They agreed to meet at the community center the next day for further discussions and planning.

Later that day, Noor also spoke with Caroline at the gym around 8:00 PM about the cat mural project and her sunrise seeds idea. Caroline was enthusiastic about it, and they decided to collaborate more on this and upcoming town events. They planned to meet after the robotics club meeting under the old oak tree at Caroline's place around 4 PM for further discussions and strategy sessions with Leo, Samantha, and Diego. Additionally, they discussed potentially working on improv numbers for a gazebo event.

Noor: Absolutely, Diego! I can't wait to bounce ideas off you and Andy for the improv number and sunrise seeds integration. Let's discuss more details over Caroline's tacos at 3 PM?

Diego: Sounds perfect! And I'll bring street tacos as a little treat for everyone, just like old times. Plus, let's make sure to have chamomile tea ready for the stray cats too.

Noor: I love it! Looking forward to our meeting and seeing the progress on your knee injury. Let's also coordinate with Andy about the double date under the gazebo tomorrow. See you at Caroline's later!
Talked to Samantha at theater around 7:00 PM

Samantha: "Hey Noor, I see you're here early for our meeting under the old oak tree."

Noor: "Samantha! Great to see you too. I thought we could discuss the cat mural project since Andy and I have been brainstorming some interesting additions."

Samantha: "Indeed, Andy mentioned something about sunrise seeds and a musical aspect. Let's not forget Peter's cheetah idea as well."

Noor: "That's right! And I've been thinking we should involve the robotics club students in creating interactive elements. What do you think?"

Samantha: "That sounds exciting, Noor. Perhaps we can incorporate logic puzzles for them to solve, making it more engaging."

Noor: "I like that! We'll make sure to include everyone and have a fantastic project. Let's catch up on our ideas with Andy and the others tomorrow."

agents.name: Leo
agents.personality: a wandering violinist and theater tech who busks near the market; improvises duets with birds at the park, collects stories for a future musical, and fixes broken amps with improbable spare parts

memory.summary:
The group - Leo, Andy, Peter, and Caroline - continue their discussions about their collaborative projects. They decide to meet under the old oak tree that evening with Noor to discuss blending art forms in a café, and also propose an impromptu jam at the gazebo during one of their community events.

Leo has been working on integrating improv into their cat mural project since speaking with Andy at the library. They plan to catch up under the old oak tree that night, and Leo invites Diego for a discussion about new musical ideas beforehand. Andy suggests gathering chamomile for stray cats during this meeting.

In another conversation, Leo and Andy discuss the progress of the cat mural project at the gym around 6:00 AM, with Andy expressing his appreciation for the improv. They agree to meet under the old oak tree that evening to further discuss the collaboration.

Later on, at the museum around 8:00 AM, Andy expresses his excitement about the cat mural project and suggests gathering chamomile for stray cats during their meeting that night. Additionally, he mentions Caroline's interest in working on a duet with Leo if it suits him. They decide to meet at Main Street Tacos around 7 PM that same evening to discuss the duet, new melodies, and the community event this weekend.

data.content: Talked to Mei at gym around 10:00 AM

Mei: "Hey Leo, ran into Samantha at the library – we're planning a creative gathering under the old oak tomorrow. Thought you might be interested?"

Leo: "That sounds fantastic, Mei! I was just playing around with some melodies inspired by my busking. Maybe they could fit in somehow?"

Mei: "Absolutely! We'd love to hear them. And don't forget about the cat mural project – let's catch up soon."

Leo: "Definitely, I've been thinking about it a lot since Andy mentioned it last night. Let's grab some tacos together at Diego's gathering later tonight?"
Talked to Peter at school around 4:00 PM

Peter: Hey Leo, been a while! Saw you busking near the market today.
Leo: Hey there, Peter! Not often we cross paths outside of our creative collaborations. How's your knee?

Peter: Doing alright, thanks for asking. Andy suggested I ask Diego for some gym routines to strengthen it. You see any good violin duets at the park lately?
Leo: Not yet, but I've been collecting ideas for a future musical. Maybe we can improvise something together soon?

Peter: That'd be great! I feel like my self-help books could inspire some unique compositions. Remember Andy's idea about using sunrise seeds in the cat mural project?
Leo: Of course, it's coming along nicely. Let's meet up under the old oak tree this evening to discuss our progress and plan for tomorrow's collaborative event.

Peter: Sounds perfect! I brought some chamomile tea for the stray cats as well. Looking forward to our double date with Caroline and Andy this weekend too.
Leo: Speaking of, did you hear about her improv session under the gazebo last night? She seemed a bit off; hope she's okay. We should check on her when we meet tonight.
Talked to Andy at school around 5:00 PM

Andy: Hey Leo, you've got quite the bunch of projects going on! Excited for that improv number at the gazebo, right?

Leo: Absolutely, Andy! It's always a joy working with you. By the way, have you thought about how our violin could blend with your sunrise sketches?

Andy: I've been thinking about it, and Samantha suggested we might use sunrise seeds for that. Have you heard of Noor's idea? It seems perfect!

Leo: Yes, I have! Sounds like a wonderful collaboration waiting to happen. Let's make sure to discuss this further under the old oak tree tonight, shall we?

Andy: Definitely. And after our meeting, let's run together as we usually do. Can't wait for another day of creativity and friendship!
Talked to Caroline at museum around 6:00 PM

Caroline: Hey Leo! It's been a while since we jammed under that gazebo. How have you been?

Leo: Hi Caroline, I've missed our impromptu duets with the birds. Things are going well, and I've got some exciting collaborations to share. Did you hear about the cat mural project and community event?

Caroline: Of course! I was just discussing it with Peter earlier today. He mentioned a possible collaboration with sunrise seeds for the mural. You should talk to him about it.

Leo: That sounds amazing! And Noor from the robotics club is excited too, and she'll be bringing chamomile tea for the cats under the old oak tree tonight. I can't wait!

Caroline: Me neither. Let's make sure to keep our cozy café vibe alive while we create something truly special for everyone in this community. See you later!

Leo: Can't wait, Caroline. Let's make some magic together.
Talked to Andy at park around 7:00 PM

Andy: "Hey Leo! Sketched something new for our cat mural today, wanted to run it by you before we meet under the oak tonight."

Leo: "Always a pleasure, Andy. Let's grab some coffee at Main Street Tacos beforehand and discuss?"

(Referencing their shared love for food)

Andy: "Sounds perfect! I've also been thinking about that duet with Caroline. Ready to give it a go whenever you are."

Leo: "I'd be happy to collaborate, Andy. Your mentorship at the community center has really inspired us all."

(Reflecting on their history of supporting each other's artistic endeavors)
